intro: Psychotria tristicula, commonly known as the "Blue Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and undergrowth. Psychotria tristicula is also noted for its potential use in traditional medicine.
